value: caption=Bolshoy Boyarsky Gorod, the Ivangorod Fortress

n border at the Narva River, opposite the Estonian city of

. Ivangorod was for most of its history more or less in municipal union with Narva, as the junior partner. It has been much more difficult to move back and forth across the Narva river following the dissolution of the Soviet Union and the ensuing poor relations between Russian and Estonia, which has divided the populace (and somewhat stranded those on the Russian side from the city's actual center).
